Description: The entirety of the visual information presented to the user as a coherent unit. Can consist of elements such as: plots, tables, auxiliary elements (e.g. title, explanatory text), interactive widgets (e.g. slider, drop-down menu).
Examples: A single static scatterplot, an interactive scatterplot matrix with linked brushing, a complex dashboard.

Description: The graphical aspect of the visual information presented to the user. Concerns various graphical elements such as colour, length, area, motion/speed.
Examples: A single realization of a (possibly interactive) visual scene, with a specific color scheme, size of graphical primitives, etc..., presented on a computer screen.
